what: Plot gene sets in two dimensions — heatplot
title: Plot gene sets in two dimensions — heatplot
text: Plot gene sets two dimensions based Jaccard distance

title: Plot gene sets in two dimensions — heatplot
code: heatplot(gsc, df_GeneMap, coef, setOverlap = 2, bicluster = TRUE, zlim = NULL)

title: Plot gene sets in two dimensions — heatplot
text: gsc GeneSetCollection object df_GeneMap result getGeneMapping() coef indicate contrast column df_GeneMap setOverlap keep genes present least many genes sets bicluster apply clustering rows columns plotting zlim scalar. specify max value color scale

what: Evaluate Gene Set Analysis with Pinnacle — pinnacle
title: Evaluate Gene Set Analysis with Pinnacle — pinnacle
text: Perform Gene Set Analysis (GSA) comparing t-statistics given gene set genome-wide t-statistics, accounting co-expression structure

title: Evaluate Gene Set Analysis with Pinnacle — pinnacle
code: pinnacle(   fit,   coef,   geneSets,   data,   formula = ~1,   setSize = c(10, 5000),   quiet = FALSE,   ... )

title: Evaluate Gene Set Analysis with Pinnacle — pinnacle
text: fit regression model fit limma::lmFit() variancePartition::dream() coef indicate coefficient contrast extracted fit using topTable geneSets GeneSetCollection GSEABase data data.frame storing properties gene, rownames gene names formula formula specifying covariates regression using t-statistics response setSize array two elements specifying min max number genes allowed gene set. gene sets satisfying criteria retained quiet suppresss messages ... arguments passed lm_each_eclairs() lm

title: Evaluate Gene Set Analysis with Pinnacle — pinnacle
text: data.frame results gene set

title: Plot gene sets in two dimensions — plot_mds
code: plot_mds(gsc, res, value = "-log10(p.shift)", zlim = c(0, NA))

title: Plot gene sets in two dimensions — plot_mds
text: gsc GeneSetCollection object res data.frame score gene set value indicate columns res use color points zlim limits colors.  c(0,NA) indicates range 0 largest observed value
